intro: Navarretia leucocephala subsp. suksdorfii, commonly known as the whiteflower navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a low-growing, herbaceous habit with linear leaves and produces numerous small seeds in its fruit. This subspecies is often found in California and is adapted to seasonal wet conditions.
